name: Bay Area Safe Routes to School
description: Safe walking/biking routes and free transit passes for students
fullDescription: Regional initiative helping students travel safely to and from school through walking, biking, and transit, with programs in all nine Bay Area counties.
whatTheyOffer:
- Engineering improvements to school routes
- Crossing guard programs
- Free or subsidized transit passes (varies by county)
- Walking and biking safety education
- Incentive programs and contests
- Community education campaigns
howToGetIt:
1. Contact your county's Safe Routes to School program
2. Programs available through participating schools
3. Some counties offer free transit passes for youth
4. Schools can request safety assessments
5. Visit sparetheairyouth.org for county contacts
keywords: Safe Routes to School, walking, biking, student, transit pass, crossing guard, school, safety, education
